message.content:
We start by locating the only direct facts in the list that mention Angela and Jerry:

• Angela appears in the statement “Randy is Angela’s descendant.” This tells us that Angela is an ancestor (or older generation) with Randy somewhere down her line.

• Jerry appears only in “Jerry is Roy’s descendant.” (And further, “Roy is Thomas’s descendant,” with “Bryan is Thomas’s ancestor” and “Bryan is Cynthia’s descendant.”) Thus Jerry’s line is a separate branch descended from Thomas (and ultimately from someone even earlier) that is not directly connected by any explicit statement with Angela’s branch.

None of the relationships given connect Angela’s branch (which, for example, has Angela → Randy → Peter … etc.) with Jerry’s branch (which comes from Thomas and Roy). We are not told that Angela is either an ancestor or a descendant of Jerry, nor is there any indication that they share some common descendant.

Even though it’s true in most family trees that any two individuals may share an ancient common ancestor, the puzzle deals only with explicitly stated relationships. Since no given statement—direct or indirect—links Angela to Jerry in terms of being ancestor/descendant or sharing a directly mentioned common ancestor or common descendant, none of the answers 1–4 are supported by the information provided.

Thus the correct answer is:

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
